name: Kesar Badam Milk
history: Kesar Badam Milk is a traditional Indian beverage known for its health benefits and rich flavor. It's made with saffron (kesar), almonds (badam), milk, and sweeteners. This drink is popular in Indian households, especially during festivals and cold seasons.
description: Kesar Badam Milk is a luxurious and nutritious drink made by infusing milk with saffron, almond paste, and sweeteners. It's a warm, comforting beverage, often served garnished with chopped nuts and flavored with cardamom.

instructions.title: Soak and Peel Almonds
instructions.description: Soak almonds in hot water for 10 minutes. Peel off the skins and make a fine paste using a little milk.

instructions.title: Boil Milk with Saffron
instructions.description: Boil the milk in a pan. Add the saffron strands and simmer for a few minutes until the milk changes color.

instructions.title: Add Almond Paste
instructions.description: Add the almond paste to the milk and stir well. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Sweeten the Milk
instructions.description: Add sugar and cardamom powder to the milk. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Pour the Kesar Badam Milk into glasses. Garnish with chopped nuts. Serve hot or chilled.

tips: Soaking the almonds makes them easier to peel and blend.
Adjust the amount of sugar according to your taste.
variations: For a vegan version, use almond milk or another non-dairy milk.
Add rose water or a few drops of vanilla extract for additional flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat gently on the stove or in the microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in traditional kulhads or decorative glasses.
Garnish with a sprinkle of saffron strands or crushed pistachios.
